overview: The isolation of Adela and Marcelino is common among many inmates processed without an interpreter in their native language before the Mexican justice system. Through their subjective experience, the dreams and memories they preserve of their lands in prison, they express in two voices the disorientation and the need to resist against exclusion by telling their story.

production_companies.name: Fondo para la Producción Cinematográfica de Calidad
Fondo Nacional para la Cultura y las Artes

title: When I Shut My Eyes
